parid 1.0
  • Get started
  • Reference

    Create grep strings for derivatives.

    createDerivGreps.Rd

    Creates grep strings for selecting the given derivatives from the output of Deriv. To this end, the codes provided in derivCodes are translated to match the names of elements of this output. The grep strings take into account that these names can be different, depending on simplifications of the output. That is, output vectors equal to 0 are sometimes reduced to single elements, and corresponding parts of their name are suppressed. Also, derivatives may be wholly or partially suppressed.

    createDerivGreps(
  derivCodes,
  compNames,
  varName,
  derivSep = "\\.",
  typeSep = "_",
  outnameSep = "_"
)

    Arguments

    derivCodes

    Vector of strings containing the derivative codes. Elements have the form 0 for the 0-th derivative, 1<derivSep><deriv> for the 1-st derivatives, and 2<derivSep><deriv><derivSep><deriv> for the second derivatives. Here <deriv> codes a derivative as <type><typeSep><variable>, where <type> is a derivative type, such as "theta" or "eta", and <variable> is a variable (from the list of variables of the given type), such as "TVCL".

    compNames

    Vector of strings specifying the names of the output components of the 0-th derivative, or NULL if they have no names.

    varName

    String specifying the variable name to be used in the output.

    derivSep

    String specifying the character(s) separating the various parts of an element of derivCodes.

    typeSep

    String specifying the character(s) separating the type and variable in elements of derivCodes.

    outnameSep

    String specifying the character(s) separating the various parts of the derivative specification in the names of the output.

    Value

    The grep strings, as a named vector of strings of the same length as derivCodes. The names of its elements are <varName><outnameSep><deriv1><outnameSep><deriv2>, where the derivatives are included as needed.

    Author

    Martijn van Noort

    Contents

    Developed by Martijn van Noort.
